• Your midwife or doctor should:
 - use a tape or ultrasound 
  scan to measure the size 
  of your uterus; 
 - measure your blood 
  pressure and test your urine 
  for protein; 
 - repeat your blood tests to 
  check for antibodies and 
  anaemia. Your midwife or 
	 	 doctor	should	offer	your	
  anti-D treatment (see page 
  62) if you are rhesus negative.
	 -	offer	and	give	you	the	
  whooping cough vaccine 
	 	 between	16–32	weeks.
